definition: to smoke/to cure over a fire
to smoke/to fumigate/to assail the nostrils/to perfume
fragrance/warm/to educate/variant of 熏[xun1]/to smoke/to fumigate
system/to control/to regulate/variant of 製|制[zhi4]

sentences.english: If you can't find smoked paprika, a little cayenne pepper or chilli powder would be lovely.
sentences.chinese: 如果没有熏制过的辣椒，放一些辣椒粉也行。

sentences.english: Such wood can give your fish good color and taste.
sentences.chinese: 最后使用果木，用果木熏制的鱼颜色漂亮口味丰富。

sentences.english: The meat also breaks down if it is overcooked.
sentences.chinese: 如果熏制过度肉也被破坏。

sentences.english: The temperature in the smoker should be maintained at 250 F to 300 F for safety.
sentences.chinese: 在熏制中温度处于华氏250度到300度才算安全。

sentences.english: High quality dry tip green tea was chosen to fume with the jasmine .
sentences.chinese: 本品系选优质烘青银针绿茶，用茉莉花熏制而成。

sentences.english: In the smoking process, squab meat becomes very soft, almost like  paste.
sentences.chinese: 在熏制的过程中，雏鸽肉变得更嫩，几乎像软面团。

sentences.english: I hear it gets even more complicated once they’re smoked. (Laughter and applause.)
sentences.chinese: 我听说一旦他们被熏制时，那事情就变得更加复杂了。

sentences.english: Do you know how to smoke hams?
sentences.chinese: 你知道如何熏制火腿吗？

sentences.english: After you finish smoking the fish, remove them and let them cool.
sentences.chinese: 熏制完成之后，将鱼移开并让其冷却。

definition: to smoke/to cure over a wood fire
marinated/to make by pickling, salting or curing
